poem:
Blowout in the Morning Hangar

A tire speaks its rupture  
in the cold steel dawn,  
rubber breath inhales  
the life from two men.  
What remains: echoed  
wheels, work halted  
by the sudden exhale  
of fate—harsh as  
broken asphalt,  
heavy as sorrow's  
silent tread.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Two workers killed by tire blowout on Delta plane in Atlanta A tire blowout on a Delta Air Lines jet during maintenance at the Atlanta airport on Tuesday killed two employees and seriously injured a third, authorities in Georgia said. The two deaths occurred early in the morning in a hangar at the Hartsfield-Jackson international airport as the workers changed the tire, Delta said in a statement. Atlanta police department Maj Kelley Collier told reporters". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Two workers killed by tire blowout on Delta plane in Atlanta A tire blowout on a Delta Air Lines jet during maintenance at the Atlanta airport on Tuesday killed two employees and seriously injured a third, authorities in Georgia said. The two deaths occurred early in the morning in a hangar at the Hartsfield-Jackson international airport as the workers changed the tire, Delta said in a statement. Atlanta police department Maj Kelley Collier told reporters
